messages.title: Your choice at this election
messages.content: On 6 May, voters in the West Ham Constituency have a clear choice. Between five more years of Gordon Brown and Labour or a fresh start with a Conservative Government and a Conservative Member of Parliament with the energy, vision and ability to get Newham really moving.

messages.title: THE CHANGE WE NEED
messages.content: From the moment Virginia Morris was chosen by local people as the Conservative Parliamentary Candidate for West Ham in April 2009, she has been working hard meeting residents, listening to their problems and campaigning on the issues that matter to local people.

messages.title: Local people, local choice: We're voting Conservative because we want to see a big society not big government.
messages.content: The Conservative Party has a vision for Britain. We believe in trusting people to take decisions that affect their lives; investing and improving our local communities to offer the everyday lives and make our families.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: tackling inequality, bringing down the national debt and rebuilding our damaged neighbourhoods
They know that their vote can make a change happen by electing a conservative MP for this constituency.

issues.economy: They know that their vote can make a change happen by electing a conservative MP for this constituency.
issues.education: They know our positive policies on the NHS, education, fighting crime and anti-social behaviour.
issues.health: They know our positive policies on the NHS, education, fighting crime and anti-social behaviour.

housing.content: tackling inequality, bringing down the national debt and rebuilding our damaged neighbourhoods

leaflet.personalStatement: Virginia says: 'The message from voters in West Ham is clear, they want to see positive change here in Newham. I have never voted Conservative before but are making a positive choice to do so on 6 May because they know our positive policies on the NHS, education, fighting crime and anti-social behaviour, tackling inequality, bringing down the national debt and rebuilding our damaged neighbourhoods.'

politicalExperience.achievements: Working hard meeting residents, listening to their problems, and campaigning on issues important to local people.

images.caption: Local people showing support for 'Voting Conservative'

leaflet.additionalNotes: Vote Virginia Morris. Vote for change on 6 May.
